programme.title: WWE Rivals
programme.sub-title: "Stone Cold" Steve Austin vs. The Rock
programme.desc: In 1998, Stone Cold Steve Austin took the sports entertainment world by storm, while Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson was a rising star in WWE. While the megastars pushed the industry to new heights, their rivalry developed both on screen and behind the scenes to create two of the most memorable Superstars in the world. Former WWE writer Freddie Prinze Jr. leads a roundtable of legends that includes Kevin Nash, Kofi Kingston, Tamina and John Bradshaw Layfield, dissecting two of WWE's biggest rivals.

programme.title: WWE Rivals
programme.desc: The on-screen rivalry between Eddie Guerrero & Rey Mysterio was a true battle between two of the most dynamic and successful luchadores in sports entertainment. From their revolutionary matches to their intense plot line involving Rey's son Dominick, both Rey & Eddie pushed the envelope when it came to storytelling in and out of the ring. A roundtable of experts composed of Freddie Prinze Jr., Kevin Nash, Natalya Neidhart, Bayley and John Bradshaw Layfield, break down this emotional journey.

programme.title: WWE Rivals
programme.desc: In 2006, John Cena & Edge's battle over the WWE Championship brought both Superstars to new heights...something they only could have reached together. Their combustible rivalry saw two men who appeared on-screen as opposites, but shared the same goal of becoming champions. Cena and Edge relive their epic conflicts against one another exclusively here. Plus, Freddie Prinze Jr. breaks it down in a roundtable discussion with Kevin Nash, Cody Rhodes, Beth Phoenix and John Bradshaw Layfield.

programme.title: Biography: WWE Legends
programme.desc: The story of WWE Legend Lex Luger--The Total Package. Boasting an impressive physique, Luger was given the moniker "The Narcissist" and later "The All American" by Vince McMahon himself. Luger found his home with the WCW, and his matches helped cement the legendary rivalry between WWE and WCW. But Luger's winning streak came to a grinding halt with drug and alcohol abuse, jail time, and the tragic death of his girlfriend, Miss Elizabeth.

programme.title: The World's End

programme.title: Thoroughbreds
programme.desc: Affluent childhood friends Lily and Amanda reconnect after spending several years apart and developing vastly different personalities, and they find common ground in a plot to murder Lily's oppressive father. programme.title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
programme.desc: A priest's visions bring FBI agents Mulder and Scully back together for an investigation into the mysterious disappearance of a group of women. David Duchovny and Gillian Anderson reprise their roles from the classic TV show in this thriller from creator Chris Carter.

programme.title: Ender's Game
programme.desc: Decades after a hostile race of aliens decimate Earth, a brilliant young strategist named Ender Wiggin is recruited to train at a special school for a mission to save mankind from certain extinction in this exciting adaptation of the classic novel.

programme.title: Fast & Furious 6
programme.desc: In this intense action flick, Agent Hobbs promises Dom and his crew full pardons if they assemble in London to stop a criminal outfit led by a ruthless mastermind whose right-hand woman is Dom's former lover Letty, whom he believed to be dead.

programme.title: The Wolverine
programme.desc: Still mourning the death of Jean Grey, Wolverine travels to Japan after an old friend tells him that he can remove his immortality, but he soon gets caught up in a conspiracy involving the yakuza in this action-packed and explosive comic-book adventure.

programme.title: Geostorm
programme.desc: In this riveting sci-fi action film, two scientists race to avert a catastrophe when a series of climate-control satellites malfunction. They soon discover a conspiracy involving the satellites, which were designed to prevent natural disasters on Earth.

programme.title: Dune
programme.desc: This version of Frank Herbert's popular 1965 sci-fi novel is the first of a two-part adaptation. This story covers only the first half of the novel and features Paul Atreides, whose duke father, Leto, accepts the stewardship of a planet called Arrakis. Since it's the main source of a most coveted substance called the melange, the leadership of its mining industry has been contentious, which the heir of the House Atreides will soon find out.

programme.title: Death on the Nile
programme.desc: While vacationing in Egypt, detective Hercule Poirot finds himself in the thick of a love triangle that goes awry. However, when a wealthy young woman winds up dead, it is up to Poirot to track down the killer before he or she can claim a new victim. Based on the novel of the same name by Agatha Christie.

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.desc: A talk show about current events with the former host of 'Politically Incorrect.' This weekly late-night forum is a virtual clone of 'P.I.,' with some Maher stand-up and a similarly diverse lineup of informed panelists, but this being HBO, the language is a good deal more blunt. In addition to the roundtable discussions, the show also features topical interviews with in-studio and satellite guests.

programme.title: House of the Dragon
programme.desc: Princess Rhaenyra dives deep into the prophecies about House Targaryen.

programme.title: Child 44
programme.desc: In this taut thriller set in 1953 Soviet Russia, an exiled secret-police agent hunts a serial killer who targets young boys. His investigation later reveals an unsettling conspiracy, which pits him against the ruthless government officials behind it.

programme.title: Killer Elite
programme.desc: Inspired by a true story, this rollicking thriller follows former special-ops agent Danny Bryce (Jason Statham) on an explosive quest through 1980s Europe as he attempts to save his mentor by eliminating a group of assassins.

programme.title: Arsenal
programme.desc: This tense action thriller centers on a construction-company owner who must rescue his brother, a petty crook, after he is abducted by a vicious mobster. He is aided in his quest by a police detective and longtime friend.

programme.title: Belfast
programme.desc: It is 1969 and 9-year-old Buddy finds his peaceful life disturbed as a national conflict is starting to brew in Northern Ireland: unionists and loyalists—mostly Protestants—want the country to remain within the United Kingdom, while nationalists and republicans—mostly Catholics—are campaigning for the country to join a united Ireland. As the tension between these two opposing forces escalates, he and his family must decide whether to stay, or move somewhere safe.

programme.title: Elvis Presley: The Searcher
programme.desc: A two-part profile of Elvis Presley begins with his early life in Mississippi; his first encounter with Sun Records' Sam Phillips; tours of the South; and his decision to sign with a national label after his manager, Col. Tom Parker, bought out his contract.

programme.title: Elvis Presley: The Searcher

programme.title: Norman Lear: Just Another Version of You - American Masters
programme.sub-title: Norman Lear: Just Another Version of You
programme.desc: A profile of Norman Lear, the creative mastermind behind such influential sitcoms as "All in the Family," "The Jeffersons," "Maude" and "Good Times." The shows changed the TV landscape in the early 1970s by using humor to promote social change. In 1981, he expanded his effort to influence public opinion by founding People for the American Way, a liberal advocacy group. The documentary features footage from Lear's own archives as well as remarks from Lear, family, friends and colleagues.

programme.desc: Carl's philosophy about accepting defeat ends up in the gutter when Harriette aces him out on the bowling lanes. Reginald VelJohnson, JoMarie Payton-France. Eddie: Darius McCrary. Rachel: Telma Hopkins.

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: Andy Garcia guest stars as Angie's brother Ray, a con artist who reappears after five years. Could it have something to do with the fact that his daughter, Veronica (Aimee Garcia), inherited millions? As it happens, Ray wants to help his daughter with her business venture.

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: George Helps Ernie See the Cellu-Light
programme.desc: Ernie needs to lose weight or else Mel will fire him, so George plays diet guru. But first he must play psychologist, because Ernie won't admit that he has a problem. Mel: Mark Tymchyshyn.

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: In a crossover episode with "Freddie," Max has struck up an online friendship with Freddie's niece Zoey (Chloe Suazo). George finds out and assumes that "Zoey" is really a pervert. In Chicago, Freddie assumes the same thing about Max.

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: George Vows to Make Some Matri-Money
programme.desc: After belittling Angie's job as a wedding planner, George becomes one himself---taking on an impossibly demanding client (Eva Longoria) whom Angie dumped to show that anything she can do he can do better.

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.sub-title: George Discovers How Mescal-ed Up His Life Would Have Been Without Benny-Fits
programme.desc: After Benny berates him for not giving her a work prize she thinks she deserved, George dreams (with the aid of a spiked drink) that she's really a warm and caring mother---and that he's a mama's boy. It's anything but a wonderful life.

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Caroline prepares for her third date with Bobby and tries to spice things up by taking a burlesque class. She's accompanied by a reluctant Max, who decides to give up sex in the wake of her breakup with Randy. She also goes golfing with Han.

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Han's new therapist suggests that Max needs to confront her "daddy issues" and fear of intimacy, so she reluctantly heads to Rhode Island to track down her birth father with the diner gang in tow. Meanwhile, Oleg gets upset when Sophie asks him to help out around the house.

programme.title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee is a treatise on greed and what "gold does to men's souls" when three miners, circa 1920s, set out to find the precious mineral in the mountains of Mexico. Oscars went to John Huston for Screenplay and Direction, and his father, Walter Huston, who won Best Supporting Actor for his performance as an old prospector.

programme.title: Key Largo
programme.desc: An adaptation of the Maxwell Anderson play about a war-weary World War II vet forced into a confrontation with the nervous, sadistic mobster who is holding the occupants of a Florida hotel hostage during a hurricane. Claire Trevor won a Supporting Actress Oscar as the gangster's drunken moll.

programme.title: To Have and Have Not
programme.desc: In World War II Martinique, a charter-boat owner agrees to a smuggling deal in an effort to help an attractive pickpocket get back to America. Later, when his first mate is taken hostage and pumped for information, the skipper must come to his rescue.

programme.title: The Big Sleep
programme.desc: A private eye is hired by a wealthy general with two daughters, one dangerously wild, one sly and observant. As the events unfold, a blackmail and extortion case turns into a murder investigation, and the PI must figure out who is playing him and why.

programme.title: Dark Passage
programme.desc: Film-noir thriller about a husband, falsely imprisoned for the murder of his wife, who escapes from jail to track down the actual murderer, but first must hide out in a woman's apartment while he recovers from plastic surgery on his face.

programme.title: The Corn Is Green
programme.desc: An ambitious teacher opens a school in a poor Welsh mining town and butts heads with the mine owners, but eventually she discovers a prize student who, after a couple of years, tries to get into an elite university.

programme.title: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
programme.desc: Best Actor Robert Donat stars as the title character, a beloved schoolmaster at a British boarding school, who initially starts out as a reticent sourpuss, but over the course of 63 years of teaching evolves into a venerable academic institution. Told in flashback, the Best Picture nominee is adapted from the James Hilton best seller. The film debut of Greer Garson (Best Actress nominee), who plays Mr. Chips' engaging young bride.

programme.title: Blackboard Jungle
programme.desc: An early film study of teens gone wild chronicles the efforts of an idealistic and dedicated teacher trying to cope with his classroom full of incorrigibles, including knife-wielding punks, in an urban high school. The film launched Bill Haley & the Comets' rock-and-roll anthem "Rock Around the Clock."

programme.title: Bright Road
programme.desc: A dedicated schoolteacher and an understanding principal in help a rebellious student overcome his circumstances and his pride in order to fulfill his potential.

programme.title: Zéro de conduite
programme.desc: In a repressive boarding school with rigid rules of behavior, four boys decide to rebel against the director on a celebration day.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: Judy Holliday is a delight in this farce about an unsuccessful model who believes her career needs a jolt of publicity, so she rents a billboard in Manhattan, emblazoned with her name on it, and sees the endorsements pour in as well as the suitors. Jack Lemmon made his screen debut as Holliday's "unofficial" boyfriend.

programme.title: The Fortune Cookie
programme.desc: An unscrupulous lawyer tries to win a hefty verdict after a cameraman is injured while filming a football game when a player runs into him. The attorney has his client exaggerate his injuries, which leads to the guilty-feeling football player waiting hand and foot on the client.

programme.title: The Prisoner of Second Avenue
programme.desc: A suddenly unemployed executive and his wife must adapt to their new life.

programme.title: Day of the Dead
programme.desc: As zombies continue to walk the Earth, a small band of civilians, scientists and trigger-happy soldiers hole up in an underground military bunker. Tensions rise among the survivors as the head scientist conducts macabre experiments on undead specimens. The third entry in George Romero's zombie series.

programme.title: I Was a Teenage Zombie
programme.desc: High-school teens kill a no-good drug dealer, who turns into a zombie with a taste for revenge. Low-budget chiller with lowbrow humor. Michael Rubin, Steve McCoy. John Elias Michalakis directed.

programme.title: The Golden Years
programme.desc: Innovations in the bowling world are featured.

programme.title: Gaslight
programme.desc: A newlywed is slowly driven to the brink of madness by her deceptively charming husband at their Victorian mansion in London. Ingrid Bergman won Best Actress as the wife, while Charles Boyer received a Best Actor nod as her spouse and Angela Lansbury, in her film debut (at age 18), was nominated for Best Supporting Actress for her role as a sassy cockney servant.

programme.title: Tom and Jerry
programme.desc: The maestro is conducting his orchestra of assorted animals. Some of them aren't particularly good at following his direction.

programme.title: How I Play Golf by Bobby Jones No. 7 the Spoon

programme.desc: Entry in the "Traveltalk" series visits Singapore and Jahore.

programme.desc: An undercover agent (Tom Keene) is sent to Texas to investigate cattle rustlers. Rochelle Hudson, Marie Wells, Julian Rivero, Hank Bell, Ernie Adams, Tom London.

programme.title: The Pool of Peril
programme.desc: Flash and his friends are captured by the rock men and must escape.

programme.title: Tarzan Triumphs
programme.desc: Tarzan (Johnny Weissmuller) goes to war when Nazis take over a jungle city. Boy: Johnny Sheffield. Zandra: Frances Gifford. Von Reichart: Stanley Ridges. Patriarch: Pedro de Cordoba. Bausch: Philip Van Zandt. Schmidt: Rex Williams. Sergeant: Sig Ruman. Archmet: Stanley Brown. William Thiele directed.

programme.title: Treasure Island

programme.desc: Weighing almost 900lbs, J.T's food addiction that will kill him if he doesn't change. His girlfriend takes him to Houston, but when his behavior drives her away, J.T. is left with only Dr. Now to help.

programme.title: My Big Fat Fabulous Life
programme.desc: Buddy goes missing in Columbus and Whitney threatens to cancel class; with the biggest city on the BGDC tour still looming, Whitney suspects sabotage when Todd messes up the choreography; and Whitney is conflicted over meeting Buddy's new girlfriend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Superfan TK brings 7 very feisty ladies with 7 very different opinions to help her choose the "it" dress. Actress Leslie has an unlimited budget but she refuses to believe her opinionated mom chose the perfect wedding gown on the very first try.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Courtney is determined to look at every dress in Kleinfeld to find the perfect one. Brianna wants a dress inspired by the movie "Fifty Shades Freed." Angela runs a circus, but she doesn't want to look like she's in the circus at her wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: That's How You Dress a Lady

programme.title: 7 Little Johnstons
programme.desc: After the family celebrates Amber's birthday, she and Anna decide to upgrade their looks. Brice and Liz are ready to take the next step in their relationship, and Trent and Amber have a heart-to-heart with Jonah about his recent behavioral issues.

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and Co. investigate the death of a teenager. Before long, they conclude that the teen may be connected to an orchestrated bombing scheme that could kill hundreds of people. Racing against time, the team scrambles to find the bomb.

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The fate of Det. Sanchez, who was shot three times and airlifted to a hospital, is revealed. In addition, the team investigates whether a suicide was actually murder. And Brenda's parents (Frances Sternhagen, Barry Corbin) pay a visit while on their way to a Hawaiian cruise.

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and her squad investigate the death of a plus-size man, whose body has so badly deteriorated that it's nearly impossible to determine how he died. Frances Sternhagen and Barry Corbin guest star as Brenda's parents.

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A known sex offender emerges as the prime suspect in the savage rape and murder of a woman. But when the suspect promptly hires a slick lawyer, Brenda must square off against the formidable attorney, who uses sly judicial tricks and manipulative tactics to defend his client. Billy Burke guest stars.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Paige gets caught in the crossfire between two feuding witch families, so she sets out to end the hostilities, not knowing that the ghost of one clan member has other plans for her. Meanwhile, Piper goes on her first date since losing Leo; and Chris seeks the aid of a sorcerer to obtain a rare potion. Richard: Balthazar Getty. Olivia: Rachelle Lefevre. Chris: Drew Fuller.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Chris cons a demon into helping him in a scheme to get the sisters to concentrate more on their Wiccan responsibilities and less on their personal lives. Meanwhile, Phoebe guest hosts a live television show. Gith: Desmond Askew. Jason: Eric Dane. Chris: Drew Fuller.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Paige tries to help a man who sold his soul to a demon in exchange for material wealth; Wyatt uses his magic to scare off prospective suitors for Piper. Zahn: Keith Szarabajka. Chris: Drew Fuller.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS investigates the disappearance of a congressional aide after a hitman saves her from two men posing as NCIS agents. Also, Lasalle struggles with life-altering decisions regarding his brother's future.

programme.desc: Pride, Sebastian and Tammy travel to South America after Pride is personally requested by a former colleague to assist with a classified operation that has been compromised.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Percy and Lasalle go undercover at a high-stakes, underground poker game after the organizer targets players with access to a naval research laboratory. Also, Laurel Pride visits her dad during spring break to discuss options after her upcoming graduation.

programme.desc: This landmark adult Western centered on Marshal Matt Dillon of Dodge City. John Wayne turned down the lead, suggesting James Arness (who remained for its entire run). Originating on radio (with William Conrad as Dillon), it moved to TV in September 1955. Its popularity spawned a number of copycats, but none would enjoy the longevity (and few the consistent quality) of this classic.
